intro: Muenteria stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited muenteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Muenteria stenocarpa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
